subject: Productivity
title: The Rise of Productivity Apps
description: A quick, practical guide to The Rise of Productivity Apps.

hook.text: There are over 10,000 productivity apps on app stores. Yet most users abandon them within a week.

buildup.text: Apps promise to organize your life. Todoist, Notion, Trello â€” each claims a unique approach.

discovery.text: Research shows that tool-switching itself wastes time. Learning a new app eats the hours it promised.

twist.text: The most productive people often use the simplest tools. A notebook outperforms a complex app.

climax.text: Apps are means, not ends. The system matters more than the software running it.

punchline.text: The tool is never the bottleneck. You are.

quiz.question: What does research say about frequently switching productivity tools?
options: It wastes time learning new apps
